Trigger A non-evil creature enters the room.

Effect The trap casts @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Phantom Pain] on the creature, and then rolls initiative.

@Check[type:will|dc:23|name:Phantom Pain|traits:mental,nonlethal] save

details.description: Daemonic curses slither and crawl through malevolent runes carved in four stone pillars. HP is per-pillar.
details.disable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:20|name:Disable Thievery] (trained) to scratch out a pillar's runes, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Dispel Magic] (2nd level; counteract DC 18) to counteract a pillar's magic, or @Check[type:athletics|dc:21|name:Disable Athletics|traits:action:force-open]{Athletics (Force Open)} to push a pillar over. Disabling a pillar requires two actions. Disabling all four pillars or slaying Sezruth disables the trap
details.routine:
Routine (4 actions) The trap loses 1 action each turn for each disabled pillar. On its initiative, the trap uses each action to afflict a different non-evil creature in the room with thirst. The creature must attempt a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:20|name:Foretold Ruin|traits:damaging-effect] save.

Critical Success The creature is temporarily immune to additional negative effects from the foretold ruin hazard's reaction for 24 hours. The hazard has no awareness of this immunity and continues to target this creature.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.Fatigued] until they drink water. If the creature was already fatigued, they take [[/r 1d6 #nonlethal mental]]{1d6 nonlethal mental damage}.

Critical Failure The creature is fatigued until they drink water and takes [[/r 1d6 #nonlethal mental]]{1d6 nonlethal mental damage}. If the creature was already fatigued, they instead take [[/r 2d6 #nonlethal mental]]{2d6 nonlethal mental damage}.

source.value: Pathfinder Society Scenario #2-21: In Pursuit of Water
